alert.note: Alert for Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 1:35AM EST until January 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Pickens. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Common, deeper flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to area streams is continuing with lesser impacts to vulnerable property. Expect extensive flooding of farmland, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, and golf courses. Inundation may be several feet deep. Other flood-prone areas will be impacted including low-lying roadways, low-water crossings, underpasses, and parking lots. Several low-water crossings, roads, and bridges may be flooded and impassible, with deeper flows over roadways possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 133 AM EST, Twelvemile and Eighteenmile Creeks have crested but remain above Minor Flood Stage following earlier heavy rainfall. It will take several more hours for these streams to fall back below bankfull. Therefore the Flood Warning will be extended into the morning hours or until streams fall back below critical levels. Expect lingering flooding to continue near the flea market and Concord Church Rd along Twelvemile Creek. Along Eighteenmile Creek, flooding may be continuing along Bishop Branch Rd and Central Rd. - Some locations that may continue to experience Minor flooding include... Easley, Clemson, Pickens, Central, Liberty, Norris, and Six Mile. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please obey all barricades, even when flood waters no longer cover the road. Barricades may remain in place until flooded roadways can be inspected for safety.
